vqa_benchmarking_backend.models.ban.model¶

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

BANAdapter

NOTE: when inheriting from this class, make sure to
class vqa_benchmarking_backend.models.ban.model.BANAdapter(device, vocab: vqa_benchmarking_backend.utils.vocab.Vocabulary, ckpt_file: str = '')¶

Bases: vqa_benchmarking_backend.datasets.dataset.DatasetModelAdapter

NOTE: when inheriting from this class, make sure to

  • move the model to the intended device

  • move the data to the intended device inside the _forward method

get_name(self) → str¶
get_output_size(self) → int¶
get_torch_module(self) → torch.nn.Module¶
question_token_ids(self, question_tokenized: List[str]) → torch.LongTensor¶
get_question_embedding(self, sample: vqa_benchmarking_backend.datasets.dataset.DataSample) → torch.FloatTensor¶
get_image_embedding(self, sample: vqa_benchmarking_backend.datasets.dataset.DataSample) → torch.FloatTensor¶
_forward(self, samples: List[vqa_benchmarking_backend.datasets.dataset.DataSample]) → torch.FloatTensor¶

Overwrite this function to connect a list of samples to your model. IMPORTANT:

  • Make sure that the outputs are probabilities, not logits!

  • Make sure that the data samples are using the samples’ question embedding field, if assigned (instead of re-calculating them, they could be modified from feature space methods)

  • Make sure that the data samples are moved to the intended device here
